byline.contributor: Kai Schultz contributed reporting from Kathmandu, Nepal.

abstract: Tilaurakot Journal; dispute between Nepal and India over location of city in which Buddha spent first 29 years of his life is heating up as both India and China use Buddhism as instrument of soft power; Unesco-backed British-Nepali team maintains ruins in Tilaurakot are site of Buddha's upbringing, while Indian consensus holds site is located in Piprahwa, across border.

headline.print_headline: A Battle Over the Buddha’s Childhood Home
headline.main: India and Nepal in Not-Very-Enlightened Spat Over Buddha’s Childhood Home

snippet: The archaeological tug of war has rumbled for more than a century, but with Buddhist history becoming serious business, the debate has taken on new urgency.
